title: 115_s1237
content: The "Family Farmer Bankruptcy Clarification Act of 2017" clarifies rules for discharge of governmental claims in Chapter 12 bankruptcies related to farm asset disposition. The "Family Farmer Bankruptcy Clarification Act of 2017" clarifies rules for discharge of governmental claims in Chapter 12 bankruptcies related to farm asset disposition. A new section, Sec. 1232, is added to address unsecured claims of a governmental unit arising from the sale of property used in a farming operation. These claims will be treated as pre-petition claims, not entitled to priority, included in a plan, and discharged under section 1228. The "Family Farmer Bankruptcy Clarification Act of 2017" adds section 1232 to address governmental claims in Chapter 12 bankruptcies related to farm asset disposition. Claims are treated as pre-petition, not entitled to priority, included in a plan, and discharged under section 1228. Governmental units can file claims arising after the petition is filed. The debtor must notify the governmental unit of any tax claims that arise after filing for bankruptcy. The notice should include details of the bankruptcy petition, court location, claim amount, and supporting documentation. The governmental unit can then file a claim in response. The governmental unit has 180 days to file a proof of claim after receiving notice. If they fail to do so, the debtor or trustee can file a claim consistent with the notice. Any claim filed will be determined and allowed or disallowed as per section 502 of the bankruptcy code. Technical and conforming amendments are made to chapter 12 of title 11, United States Code. In the United States Code, amendments are made to sections 1222 and 1228 regarding the treatment of claims by governmental units in bankruptcy cases. Section 1222 is amended to include provisions for the treatment of claims by governmental units as described in section 1232. Section 1228 is also amended to specify procedures for filing claims by governmental units. In the United States Code, amendments are made to sections 1222 and 1228 regarding the treatment of claims by governmental units in bankruptcy cases. Section 1222 is amended to include provisions for the treatment of claims by governmental units as described in section 1232. Section 1228 is also amended to specify procedures for filing claims by governmental units. In subsection (c)(2), amendments are made by inserting a comma after "all debts provided for by the plan" and after "allowed under section 503 of this title." Additionally, in paragraph (2), changes are made by replacing "the kind" with "a kind specified in section 523(a) of this title, except as provided in section 1232(c)." Amendments are made to section 1229(a) of the United States Code to provide for the payment of a claim described in section 1232(a) that arose after the date on which the petition was filed. Effective Date: The amendments made by this section apply to bankruptcy cases pending on the date of enactment of this Act without a discharge order under section 1228 of title 11, United States Code, or cases commencing after the enactment date.
